_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT

To the best of the undersigneds knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.

__________________________________________           ______________________________
LeRoy Triebold, President                                                        Date

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility:  This facility complies with all requirements for anhydrous ammonia storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Valley City Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

A description of your facility and the regulated substance handled.  This is an anhydrous ammonia storage facility which distributes to area farmers.  The facility consists of a 12,000 gallon tank and associated piping to fill nurse tanks.

The worst case release scenario.  Our worst-case scenariois the failure of the 12,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed, resulting in a gas release.  According the EPA's look-up table, the distance the the endpoint is 2.8 miles.  There are ......

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps.  This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and ll applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with state law.

Five year accident history.  We have never had an accident involving propane that caused deaths, injuries property or environmental damage, evacutation, or shelterings in place.

The emergency response program.  In the event of an emvergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is our policy to notify the Valley City Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy

with the fire department and they have inspected our anhydrous ammonia system.

Planned changes to improve safety.  We are always looking for improvements and analize any changes that might come along.
